summary: Ross L. Crozier, also known as Agent VAIVADA and Arthur G. Vaivada, was involved in CIA operations, including Project HUMANOID in Costa Rica. The documents span from 1952 to 1975, covering his contract extensions, operational clearance requests, and suitability for contact agent work. He was also considered for promotion. The documents include biographical information, agent evaluations, receipts, and file requests. He was involved in agent activities in Mexico and operational contacts in Havana. The documents also mention modifications to agent contracts and the establishment of military cover backstops.
significance: The provided documents do not explicitly mention any connection to the JFK assassination. Ross L. Crozier's significance appears to be related to his role as a CIA agent involved in various operations and projects, particularly in Costa Rica and Mexico.
